results.title: Celebration of a nation
results.brief_description: Produced to celebrate Australia’s bicentenary in 1988, this short picture postcard presents images of Australia’s distinct landscape, flora and fauna, new Australian’s sharing their experiences, archival footage of the colonial era and Australian’s at war, natural disasters, and footage of the entertainment industry; music, dance, performance and radio. The soundtrack is a combination of Australian rock as well as instrumental “patriotic” songs.

results.title: Celebration
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Rex Tasker and William Weintraub
results.brief_description: A portrait of Canada in many moods, costumes, and poses, on the eve of its one hundredth birthday. These are still pictures, hundreds of them, from the northernmost igloo to the southernmost meadow - pictures of people, places, activities, all with the style, the flair to fit the celebration. The music of the Oscar Peterson Trio is featured in the film.

results.title: Celebrating whole language
results.creator_credit: Melbourne College of Advanced Education. Media Production Centre, Dennis Claringbold, Steve Macdonald, Keith Pigdon and Marilyn Woolley
results.brief_description: Professors Ken and Yetta Goodman are interviewed by Howard Mould, Pat Long and Marilyn Woolley about the “Whole Language Approach” to language learning. The interviews are intercut with scenes of the Goodmans in classrooms in Victoria which illustrate their child-centred approach. A useful resource for parent-teacher evenings, professional development, curriculum days and ELIC courses.

results.title: Celebrating our differences : race
results.brief_description: This video attempts to explain race and dispel some of the misconceptions people have about the subject. Race in humans can be compared to breeds in dogs - different breeds of dogs belong to the same species, but there is great diversity in their characteristics. Students will be introduced to the three principle races, the reasons for differences in skin colours, human characteristics that race does not affect (eg. intelligence and strength), and probable reasons for racial differences. No further credits available. Suitable for Mid-Upper Primary level students. Teacher’s guide included.

results.title: Celebrating Bird: the triumph of Charlie Parker
results.creator_credit: Toby Byron, Multiprises, Sony Video Software Company and Pioneer Artists
results.brief_description: Charlie Parker, famously known as Bird, won fame as the king of the hipsters with his virtuoso saxophone playing and innovative jazz. This work traces his life story from Kansas City to the New York jazz scene of the 1950s, tracing the short, somewhat tragic journey of a lauded and revered, if commercially ignored, musician. As well as providing key performances of signature tunes - Ballade, Yardbird Suite, Just friends, Koko, Confirmation, Au Privave and Kim Bloomdido - this work also comprises his only surviving TV performance, and interviews with Bird’s contemporaries. Contains wonderful vintage footage of Bird performing, plus tunes performed by Thelonious Monk, Louis Armstrong and Count Basie.

results.title: Ceiling with scrapite finish
results.creator_credit: Topical Film Company and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Plastering”.
One of a series of four films which gives a basic training in plastering as applied to building construction. The use of expanded metal lathing is demonstrated and the way in which the plaster adheres to it. Three coats are applied, render, float and set. The making of dots and screeds is shown. Before the final coat is applied the cornice is run. The method of cutting the mould for this and the addition of horse and handle is shown. Screeds and running rule are fitted in position and the cornice is run. Finally, the finishing coat is applied to the ceiling.

results.title: Cecily (K)
results.brief_description: An animated film about a little girl who, discovering she can fly by flapping her ears, takes off for Africa. She makes friends with the elephants, who have ears as big as hers, and forms an elephant orchestra which becomes world famous. Based on the story by Milos Macourek.

results.title: Cecil B. Demented
results.creator_credit: Studio Canal, Artic Productions, John Fiedler, Joe Caracciolo Jr, Mark Tarlov and John Waters
results.brief_description: John Water’s Cecil B Demented is an anarchic kick to the bloated carcus that is mainstream Hollywood feature films. No one escapes Waters’ skewered assault as he derides the mediocrity that now inhabits the American studio system. The plot is a compendium of Waters’ previous film work and favorite obsessions, offering up kidnapping, demented ciniphiles, scathing parodies (the highlight being the Forest Gump sequel, ‘Gumped again’) and highly specific sexual perversity. Steven Dorf stars as Cecil B Demented, the deranged leader of the ‘Sprocket Holes’, a gang of film fanatics hell bent on overthrowing the Hollywood A-list and out to “punish bad cinema”. Their insane plan involves kidnapping megalomanic movie star Honey Whitlock (Melanie Griffith relishing her role as the bitchy diva) and forcing her to appear in their own underground movie. What ensues is a wild parody of hollywood movie making, while Waters affectionately sends up his own days as a filmmaking terrorist. Cast includes: Alicia Witt, Mink Stole, Ricki Lake, Patricia Hearst, Adrien Grenier, Larry Gillard Jr.
